metadata.title: Procedural Game World Generation Using Algorithms and Noise Functions

abstract.text: Procedural world generation enables the creation of large, diverse game environments using algorithmic techniques. This paper studies noise functions, terrain synthesis, and rule-based content generation.

body_text.text: Modern games rely on procedural techniques to generate terrain, vegetation, and structures. These methods reduce storage requirements and enhance replayability.
We examine Perlin noise, cellular automata, and graph-based algorithms for generating coherent game worlds.
The results demonstrate that hybrid approaches produce more natural and engaging virtual environments.
